thread.title: Lisa Faulkner teases new EastEnders character and admits "great" role came completely out of the blue
thread.title_full: Lisa Faulkner teases new EastEnders character and admits "great" role came completely out of the blue

author: Kyle O'Sullivan
title: Lisa Faulkner teases new EastEnders character and admits "great" role came completely out of the blue
text:
Lisa Faulkner teases new EastEnders character and admits "great" role came completely out of the blue The Celebrity MasterChef winner joined the soap after bosses sold her the role of businesswoman Fi Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Lisa Faulkner teases her new EastEnders character Share this video Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing!   
Lisa Faulkner has teased her mysterious new EastEnders character as she said the call about the role came "completely out of the blue." 
The actress and celebrity chef revealed she has already filmed her first scenes and is getting used to the fast pace of the show. 
Not much has been released about the character, businesswoman Fi Browning , who has been described as "stylish and sophisticated". 
Speaking to stand-in Lorraine host Christine Bleakley, Lisa said: “I started filming a couple of days ago and it’s a bit of a baptism. Read More Lisa has already started filming on the Square (Photo: Rex Features) Her new cookbook 'From Mother to Mother' was released today (Photo: Rex Features) 
“You just go into this place and go ‘oh my gosh it’s so fast’. 
“But everybody is really lovely and it came completely out of the blue." 
Lisa is making a return to TV drama after winning Celebrity MasterChef in 2010 and forging a successful career as a cookery author, writing several bestselling books and presenting numerous cooking programmes. 
She was on the show to talk about her new quick and easy cook book, which features some of her famous friends including Angela Griffin and Kate Thornton. Read More 'Where's Sonia when you need her?!': EastEnders fans cry-out for Natalie Cassidy's return as Bex's horrific storyline continues The actress and celebrity chef is also busy promoting her new cookbook (Photo: Rex Features) 
Lisa added: “I was expecting to do my book publicity, I was expecting to do some more cooking, I had recipes to write, I’m doing all this other stuff cooking on telly which I love. 
“And the [EastEnders] producers phoned up and asked if I could go and meet them and I met Sean the producer and Julie the casting director. 
“He just sold this character to me, he was very good at pitching this great character and the show. 
“I sort of came back thinking 'let's just see what happens'. 
“Then they phoned and asked if I’d do it and I thought ‘why not jump in and see? What’s the worst that could happen?’ 
“She’s a great character so I’m looking forward to playing her.” Lisa will play businesswoman Fi Browning (Photo: Rex Features) 
Executive producer Sean O'Connor has said he sees Lisa as a major part of the soap moving forward. 
He said: "I’m really thrilled that we have been able to tempt Lisa Faulkner back to TV drama and back to the BBC. 
"She’s an extremely accomplished and hugely popular actress and we’re very excited to have her in Albert Square. 
"Fi Browning is something of a departure for EastEnders; a no-nonsense but sophisticated business woman with strength and vulnerability. 
"But does she have an agenda? And who - or what- has she set her sights on?” Could Lisa use her cooking skills in Ian's chippy or the Queen Vic? (Photo: Rex Features) 
Viewers can't wait for Lisa to appear on the show and suggested she could teach Albert Sqaure's residents how to cook. 
One fan said: "@lisafaulkner1 In Eastenders! Better stay away from the chip fat in Ian Beale’s chippy" 
Another added: "Lisa Faulkner had better keep away from the Queen Vic coz Aunt Babe will be well jealous of the real life Chef #mothertomother #Lorraine x" 
While a third said: "@lisafaulkner1 @ITVLorraine you gonna teach Ian Beale some tricks soon?" Like us on Facebook
